intro: Talguenea quinquenervia, commonly known as the five-veined fern, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with five prominent veins running along the central axis. Talguenea quinquenervia plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native ecosystem.
